msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; headings and incipits of the texts (in alternating red and black lines); parts of the Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus; elements of the Canon tables; the word mǝʿǝraf; “tituli” written in the upper margin; lines starting and closing the list of the “tituli” (fols. 6r, 41va, 71vb, 109vb); numbers of the “tituli”; closing line of each Gospel with the stichometry; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of the Ethiopic numerals; Chi Rho signs; legends above and below the miniatures.

msItem.note: - The list of the “tituli” of the Gospel of Matthew is preceded by an unusually long introduction (fol. 6r).
- The “tituli” of the Gospel of Matthew are not numbered.
- The “tituli” are written ink in the upper or lower margins.
- Some letters and at times entire words on fol. 1rv are faded or blurred.
- Readings for particular occasions are separated from each with a black line occasionally ornamented at the ends (e.g., fol. 12rb l.6, 13ra l.7).
- Quotation signs resemble the letter ነ with a “ring” (e.g., fols. 13va ls. 13-26, 23rb ls. 10-20).

- There is a small red cross and a small black cross on the margins of some fols. (above the Chi-Ro sign). Their function has not been determined (e.g., fols. 32rb l.11, 32va l.36, 33rb l.1, 35va l.10).

- Some “tituli” are written in tiny letters in black ink in the upper margin, at the very edge of pages. Perhaps they served the scribe to plan how to distribute the text. At times they are partly cut off (fols. 18rv, 19r, 27r, 28r, 29r, 33r, 37rv, 39r, 40v, 48r, 77r, 80ra, 101rb, 101vb, 102rab).
- The numbering of the chapters of the Gospel of Matthew is faulty since the number 47 (fol. 31ra) is followed by 59 (fol. 31vb) and 51 (fol. 32ra).
- The “tituli” in the Gospels of Luke and John are only occasionally numbered. Also, the Chi Ro sign in the Gospel of Mark, Luke and John is much less often used than in the Gospel of Matthew.

signatures.note: - Quire mark is written in the upper left corner of fol. 16r.

decoDesc.decoNote: - Fol. 10r (incipit of the Gospel of Matthew): wide, coloured (red, yellow, green and white), ornamental band over col. a-b, with three lateral extensions decorated with geometric motifs, reaching the bottom of the text; the middle extension ends with a red horizontal base; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page (interlaces, crosses); in the upper part an inscription ዘልደት.

- Fol. 45r (incipit of the Gospel of Mark): wide, coloured (red, yellow, green and white), ornamental band over col. a-b, with three short lateral extensions (probably incomplete) decorated with geometric motifs; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page (interlaces, crosses); in the upper part two inscriptions ዘጥምቀት and ዘ፵ ጾም.

- Fol. 73r (incipit of the Gospel of Luke): wide, coloured (red, yellow, blue and white), ornamental band over col. a-b, with three lateral extensions decorated with geometric motifs reaching half of the page; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page (interlaces, crosses); in the upper part an inscription ዘዘካርያስ.
